channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A federal judge dismisses the DOJ's effort to get voter data from California
item.description: The Trump administration has been dealt its first legal setback in its unprecedented effort to consolidate voter data traditionally held by states.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration has been dealt its first legal setback in its unprecedented effort to consolidate voter data traditionally held by states.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: Behind the front lines of the legal battle against Trump's National Guard deployments
item.description: As President Trump began a pattern of deploying the National Guard to democratic-led cities, several Democratic attorneys general and their staffs worked to coordinate their fight against the deployments – and, ultimately, they won.
item.content:encoded:
As President Trump began a pattern of deploying the National Guard to democratic-led cities, several Democratic attorneys general and their staffs worked to coordinate their fight against the deployments – and, ultimately, they won.

(Image credit: David Pashaee)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Trump health care plan doesn't help people facing skyrocketing ACA premiums
item.description: President Trump announced a plan that addresses drug costs and health savings accounts, but not the health insurance premium spikes that millions of Americans are facing.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump announced a plan that addresses drug costs and health savings accounts, but not the health insurance premium spikes that millions of Americans are facing.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Verizon just had a big outage. Here's what we know
item.description: Verizon says a software problem caused the glitch and it is conducting a postmortem, but experts say outages are "a fact of life" these days.
item.content:encoded:
Verizon says a software problem caused the glitch and it is conducting a postmortem, but experts say outages are "a fact of life" these days.

(Image credit: Jenny Kane)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Trump threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act (again). What is it?
item.description: As protests grow over violent ICE enforcement actions in Minneapolis, the president said he could invoke a centuries-old law that would give him sweeping powers to deploy the military in U.S. cities.
item.content:encoded:
As protests grow over violent ICE enforcement actions in Minneapolis, the president said he could invoke a centuries-old law that would give him sweeping powers to deploy the military in U.S. cities.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: There's an internet blackout in Iran. How are videos and images getting out?
item.description: Starlink is illegal in Iran, but people are still using the satellite internet service to get around the government's internet shutdown.
item.content:encoded:
Starlink is illegal in Iran, but people are still using the satellite internet service to get around the government's internet shutdown.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Iran's protests appear increasingly smothered after a deadly crackdown
item.description: The nationwide protests challenging Iran's theocracy appear increasingly smothered a week after authorities shut the country off from the world and escalated a bloody crackdown.
item.content:encoded:
The nationwide protests challenging Iran's theocracy appear increasingly smothered a week after authorities shut the country off from the world and escalated a bloody crackdown.

(Image credit: Vahid Salemi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Julian Barnes says he's enjoying himself, but that 'Departure(s)' is his last book
item.description: Part memoir and part fiction, Barnes' hybrid novel publishes the day after his 80th birthday. He's been living with a rare form of blood cancer for six years.
item.content:encoded:
Part memoir and part fiction, Barnes' hybrid novel publishes the day after his 80th birthday. He's been living with a rare form of blood cancer for six years.

(Image credit: Stuart C. Wilson)
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: 24 hours of chaos as mental health grants are slashed then restored
item.description: For 24 hours, it was unclear which mental health and addiction programs would survive and who would still have jobs when the dust settled.
item.content:encoded:
For 24 hours, it was unclear which mental health and addiction programs would survive and who would still have jobs when the dust settled.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: This country taxes menstrual pads as luxury goods. She's aiming to end the tax
item.description: Bushra Mahnoor remembers the shame she felt when she had her period as a teen and did not have the supplies she needed. Today she leads a campaign to lower prices for pads in Pakistan.
item.content:encoded:
Bushra Mahnoor remembers the shame she felt when she had her period as a teen and did not have the supplies she needed. Today she leads a campaign to lower prices for pads in Pakistan.

(Image credit: Ben de la Cruz/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel
